name: unevenly
content:
unevenly adverb
(NOT EVEN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not level, equal, flat, or continuous: The two boxers were unevenly matched. The main problem with regular backpacks is that the weight is unevenly distributed.
More examplesFewer examplesThe effects of global warming are unevenly spread across the globe.There were a few dishes unevenly stacked on the counter next to the sink.The benefits of progress have been distributed unevenly.

Unfairness and favouring someone unfairly
unevenly adverb
(NOT GOOD)
in a way that is not always of a good quality: The team played unevenly for the first two months of the season. They play well and sing unevenly. See
uneven
More examplesFewer examplesThis unevenly acted production needs a more disciplined staging.The play was performed unevenly by a cast of 36, of whom only eight are professional actors.It is an unevenly successful, often predictable piece of theatre.
